1641.verse: وَقَالَ|But said|73|82|1089$ٱلَّذِى|the one who|103|121|138$نَجَا|was saved|90|108|9041$مِنْهُمَا|of the two|90|108|966$وَٱدَّكَرَ|and remembered|129|147|9042$بَعْدَ|after|52|70|1117$أُمَّةٍ|a period,|78|87|3159$أَنَا۟|"I|42|77|2308$أُنَبِّئُكُم|[I] will inform you|136|206|5082$بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ|of its interpretation|149|219|8987$فَأَرْسِلُونِ|so send me forth.|137|172|9043$

1643.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|80|309$تَزْرَعُونَ|"You will sow|108|122|9051$سَبْعَ|(for) seven|94|108|303$سِنِينَ|years,|70|84|9020$دَأَبًا|as usual,|79|94|9052$فَمَا|and that which|120|134|132$حَصَدتُّمْ|you reap|94|101|9053$فَذَرُوهُ|so leave it|89|99|9054$فِى|in|48|68|89$سُنۢبُلِهِۦٓ|its ears|84|104|9055$إِلَّا|except|65|85|86$قَلِيلاً|a little|63|83|433$مِّمَّا|from which|92|112|216$تَأْكُلُونَ|you (will) eat.|113|123|2892$

1645.verse: ثُمَّ|Then|53|64|293$يَأْتِى|will come|80|102|2311$مِنۢ بَعْدِ|after|91|112|280$ذَٲلِكَ|that|64|86|28$عَامٌ|a year|62|84|9060$فِيهِ|in it|49|70|32$يُغَاثُ|will be given abundant rain|197|208|9061$ٱلنَّاسُ|the people|90|186|112$وَفِيهِ|and in it|74|267|9062$يَعْصِرُونَ|they will press."|125|222|9063$

1640.verse: They said, "[It is but] a mixture of false dreams, and we are not learned in the interpretation of dreams."

1641.verse: But the one who was freed and remembered after a time said, "I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me forth."

1642.verse: [He said], "Joseph, O man of truth, explain to us about seven fat cows eaten by seven [that were] lean, and seven green spikes [of grain] and others [that were] dry - that I may return to the people; perhaps they will know [about you]."

1643.verse: [Joseph] said, "You will plant for seven years consecutively; and what you harvest leave in its spikes, except a little from which you will eat.

1644.verse: Then will come after that seven difficult [years] which will consume what you saved for them, except a little from which you will store.

1645.verse: Then will come after that a year in which the people will be given rain and in which they will press [olives and grapes]."

1646.verse: And the king said, "Bring him to me." But when the messenger came to him, [Joseph] said, "Return to your master and ask him what is the case of the women who cut their hands. Indeed, my Lord is Knowing of their plan."

1647.verse: Said [the king to the women], "What was your condition when you sought to seduce Joseph?" They said, "Perfect is Allah! We know about him no evil." The wife of al-'Azeez said, "Now the truth has become evident. It was I who sought to seduce him, and indeed, he is of the truthful.

1648.verse: That is so al-'Azeez will know that I did not betray him in [his] absence and that Allah does not guide the plan of betrayers.
